responses: Facilities for sports and games include a soccer ground, a cricket ground with nets, three basketball courts, three lawn tennis courts, three volleyball courts and three raw volleyball courts, one indoor badminton court and other outdoor badminton courts, a gymnasium, a billiards room, a chess room, a jogging track, table tennis boards and a swimming pool is in future plans.

patterns: tell me about hostels in mnit
how are hostel facilities in mnit
what is the hostel facility in MNIT
how are hostels in MNIT
responses: MNIT has 10 boys and 2 girls hostels with an accommodation capacity of about 3000 students. The largest among them is Aurobindo Hostel comprising 950 single bed rooms. First year students are allotted triple bed rooms and from second Year onwards everyone gets single bed rooms. Most of the hostels are equipped with mess. Students are given Wifi, LAN, common room and sports facilities in hostels.

responses: MNIT has 4 functional gates currently : Main Gate, Deans Gate, Back Gate and Faculty Residents gate.

What extracurricular activities are there for students in mnit?

what are different cultural societies in mnit?
responses: MNIT has different cultural socities to hone and sharpen different talents of students in addition to academics. Some of such socities are Zine-the robotic society, DIL- the dramatics society, Mavericks - Weekly newsletter service, Technical Society,creative arts and cultural society

patterns: tell me something about vltc
where are the lectures held?
where are the lectures conducted?
where are the classes taken
where are the lectures taken
what is vltc
what does vltc stands for?
responses: VLTC stands for Vivekanand Lecture Theatre Complex. It is the place where lectures are held. It has 40 class rooms that can accommodate about 5,500 students at a time.It holds the record of being Asia's Largest Lecture Theatre Complex

patterns: what is MRC
what is material research center
is there any research center in mnit?
what does MRC stands for
tell me about MRC
tell me something about MRC
responses: Materials Research Center (MRC) has infrastructure for advanced research in various streams with focus on materials. The facilities are extended to the scientists and researchers of other institutes. Equipment at the center, set up at the cost of $6.3 million, offers a wide range of research assistance. Various machines, facilities and software available in the lab
